title: Changing variable name throws compilation error. Doesn't work on 1.65 but does on 1.64

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
This compiles if the variable is `Context.pool` but when I change it to `Context.db` it gets this error. This is 100& reproducible. 1.64 causes no error

<!--
Thank you for finding an Internal Compiler Error! 🧊  If possible, try to provide
a minimal verifiable example. You can read "Rust Bug Minimization Patterns" for
how to create smaller examples.

http://blog.pnkfx.org/blog/2019/11/18/rust-bug-minimization-patterns/

-->

### Code

```Rust
impl juniper::Context for Context {}
impl Context {
  pub async fn new(req: &actix_web::HttpRequest, claim: &Claim) -> Result<Self, Error> {
    Ok(Context {
      //These clones are basically free because everything in App::Data is happening under an Arc
      db: req.app_data::<Data<sqlx::PgPool>>()
        .ok_or(CustomError::from("Missing DB pool"))?
        .get_ref()
        .clone()
    })
  }
}

impl User {
  pub async fn get_by_id(_: Grant<BasicEmployee>, ctx: &Context, id: i32) -> Result<Self, CustomError> {
    Ok(sqlx::query_as!(Self, "select * from \"user\" where user_id = $1", id).fetch_one(&ctx.db).await?)
  }
}
```


### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.65.0 (897e37553 2022-11-02)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 897e37553bba8b42751c67658967889d11ecd120
commit-date: 2022-11-02
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.65.0
LLVM version: 15.0.0
```
